text:
(1)

Devoe Ave., west side, between East 174th and East 177th Streets, showing the G. Wilson Mansion. It was demolished between 1913 and 1927 and on its site (and the surrounding land) was constructed Starlight Amusement Park. The house stood about fifty feet northwest of where the band stand of the park now (1938) stands.

1915.

(2)

A view of the entrance to the mansion.

1915.

(3)

The remains of a small stone and brick structure adjoining the
house, seen on the left in view 1.

1915.

house, seen on the left in view 1.

1915.

Starlight Amusement Park (Bronx): The south end of the park showing the swimming pool and reservoir, seen from the E. 174th Street bridge over the Bronx River. The entrance to the park is on the south side of E. 177th Street, at Devoe Avenue.

July 18, 1928
Views 1, 2

P. L. Sperr

(3)

The same, years later.

July 23, 1940.
title: Bronx: Starlight Amusement Park.
